name: @toolprint/hypertool-mcp
description: HyperTool MCP proxy server for routing requests between clients and multiple underlying MCP servers

scripts.smithery:build: tsc && npx @smithery/cli build src/server.ts --out dist/server.cjs --transport stdio
scripts.smithery:build:container: npm run docker:build && echo 'Container build completed for Smithery'
scripts.smithery:dev: tsc && npx @smithery/cli playground --port 3000 -- node dist/server.js --mcp-config mcp.minimal.json --transport http --port 3000
scripts.smithery:dev:container: npm run docker:build:local && docker run --rm -p 3000:8080 -d --name smithery-test hypertool-mcp:latest && echo 'Container running on http://localhost:3000 - use Smithery playground' && echo 'Stop with: docker stop smithery-test'
scripts.smithery:test: tsc && npx @smithery/cli playground --port 3001 -- node dist/server.js --mcp-config mcp.minimal.json --transport http --port 3001
scripts.smithery:test:container: npm run docker:build:local && docker run --rm -p 3001:8080 --name smithery-test-alt hypertool-mcp:latest
scripts.smithery:playground:docker: npm run smithery:dev:container && sleep 5 && npx @smithery/cli playground --port 3000
scripts.smithery:stop: docker stop smithery-test smithery-test-alt 2>/dev/null || echo 'No Smithery test containers running'
scripts.inspector:http: tsc && concurrently "node dist/server.js --mcp-config mcp.container.json --transport http --port 3000" "sleep 2 && npx @modelcontextprotocol/inspector http://localhost:3000/mcp"
scripts.service:start:dev: tsc && node dist/bin.js service start --profile development
scripts.service:start:prod: tsc && node dist/bin.js service start --profile production
scripts.build: rm -rf dist && tsc && npm run copy-examples && chmod +x dist/bin.js
scripts.prepublishOnly: npm run format && npm run build && npm run test
scripts.docker:setup: docker buildx create --name multiarch --use --bootstrap 2>/dev/null || docker buildx use multiarch
scripts.docker:build: npm run docker:setup && docker buildx bake hypertool-mcp
scripts.docker:build:local: npm run docker:setup && docker buildx bake hypertool-mcp-local
scripts.docker:build:dev: npm run docker:setup && docker buildx bake hypertool-mcp-dev
scripts.docker:build:push: npm run docker:setup && docker buildx bake --set '*.output=type=registry' hypertool-mcp
scripts.docker:test: npm run docker:build:local && docker run --rm -p 8080:8080 -d --name hypertool-test hypertool-mcp:latest && sleep 10 && curl -f http://localhost:8080/health && docker stop hypertool-test
scripts.docker:clean: docker buildx prune -f && docker system prune -f
scripts.dev:docker: npm run build && npm run docker:build:local && npm run docker:compose:up
scripts.dev:docker:test: npm run build && npm run docker:build:local && npm run docker:compose:test:up
scripts.inspector:docker:production:
npm run docker:build:local && docker-compose up -d && echo '

scripts.inspector:docker:test:
npm run docker:build:local && docker-compose -f docker-compose.test.yaml up -d && echo '
ðŸš€ HyperTool MCP running in Docker (test config)
ðŸ“Š Server: http://localhost:8080/mcp
ðŸ” Run this in another terminal:
   npm run inspector:connect
' && docker-compose -f docker-compose.test.yaml logs -f
scripts.inspector:docker:stop: docker-compose down && docker-compose -f docker-compose.test.yaml down 2>/dev/null || true
scripts.inspector:docker:quick: npm run inspector:docker:stop && npm run inspector:docker:production
